intro: Goniothalamus wightii, commonly known as the Wight's goniothalamus, is a member of the family Annonaceae and is native to Southeast Asia. It is a small to medium-sized evergreen tree that typically grows in lowland tropical rainforests. The plant is characterized by its simple, alternate leaves and small, fragrant flowers that are usually white or pale yellow. Its fruit is a berry that turns from green to red when mature, containing several seeds. Due to its limited distribution and habitat specificity, it is considered a rare and ecologically significant species.
